citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Four dogs were observed to have fleas (#60 Brown teddy bear, #59 White F Bichon, #14 F Mini Teddy Bear, and #6
White Pomeranian). Other dogs in the kennel were seen occasionally scratching, which can be a sign of fleas. The
presence of fleas was pointed out to the licensee and isn't under any treatment. Fleas can cause discomfort and spread
sickness in dogs. Ensure that the attending veterinarian is contacted about the fleas in the kennel and that a flea
treatment program is put into place for the whole kennel to protect each dog.
***Correct by Saturday 10/12/2024.

Three dispositions did not have the name and/or address of whom puppies were sold to. The address that records where
dogs were sold to can be important for animal health tracking. Ensure to obtain and maintain a record of name and
address of whom dogs are sold to.

Three disposition records lacked a date of when puppies were sold and/or picked up by the buyer. A date of sale can be
important in animal health tracking. Ensure that a date of sale is obtained and maintained on the Record of Disposition
when selling dogs/puppies.
***To be corrected from 10/10/2024 forward.

The floors on the inside of the kennel have shavings that are put by the water dishes to absorb splashed water, but these
wet soiled shavings are not removed daily. Also, the outdoor runs have shavings on the floor to absorb waste but have
excreta that is not being spot cleaned daily. Lack of daily spot cleaning on hard surfaces doesn't maintain the kennel
clean and can increase risk of sickness. Ensure that hard surfaces that dogs can touch are spot cleaned daily and are
cleaned often enough so that all animals have the freedom to avoid contact with excreta.
***Maintain correct from 10/10/2024 forward.

Three dogs were observed to have matted hair and need haircuts:
#59 White F Bichon,
#14 F Mini Teddy Bear,
#6 White Pomerianian
Haircoats must be maintained in a manner that prevents matted hair coats. Ensure that these dogs' hair coats are
trimmed so that they are not matted and that all dogs' coats are maintained unmatted.
***Correct by 10/18/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Four dogs were observed to have fleas (#60 Brown teddy bear, #59 White F Bichon, #14 F Mini Teddy Bear, and #6 
White Pomeranian). Other dogs in the kennel were seen occasionally scratching, which can be a sign of fleas. The 
presence of fleas was pointed out to the licensee and isn't under any treatment. Fleas can cause discomfort and spread 
sickness in dogs. Ensure that the attending veterinarian is contacted about the fleas in the kennel and that a flea 
treatment program is put into place for the whole kennel to protect each dog. 
***Correct by Saturday 10/12/2024. 
2.75(a)(1)(iv)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Three dispositions did not have the name and/or address of whom puppies were sold to. The address that records where 
dogs were sold to can be important for animal health tracking. Ensure to obtain and maintain a record of name and 
address of whom dogs are sold to. 
2.75(a)(1)(v) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Three disposition records lacked a date of when puppies were sold and/or picked up by the buyer. A date of sale can be 
important in animal health tracking. Ensure that a date of sale is obtained and maintained on the Record of Disposition 
when selling dogs/puppies. 
***To be corrected from 10/10/2024 forward. 
3.1(c)(3) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The floors on the inside of the kennel have shavings that are put by the water dishes to absorb splashed water, but these 
wet soiled shavings are not removed daily. Also, the outdoor runs have shavings on the floor to absorb waste but have 
excreta that is not being spot cleaned daily. Lack of daily spot cleaning on hard surfaces doesn't maintain the kennel 
clean and can increase risk of sickness. Ensure that hard surfaces that dogs can touch are spot cleaned daily and are

cleaned often enough so that all animals have the freedom to avoid contact with excreta. 
***Maintain correct from 10/10/2024 forward. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Three dogs were observed to have matted hair and need haircuts: 
#59 White F Bichon,  
#14 F Mini Teddy Bear,  
#6 White Pomerianian 
 
Haircoats must be maintained in a manner that prevents matted hair coats. Ensure that these dogs' hair coats are 
trimmed so that they are not matted and that all dogs' coats are maintained unmatted.  
***Correct by 10/18/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
